events.name: Cloud Study Jam - GCP Essentials

venue.name: CITY College, International Faculty of the University of Sheffield

events.description:
The Cloud Study Jam is hosted by CITY College, International Faculty of the University of Sheffield, on the 5th floor, at Ethra Lab.

The maximum capacity of the Lab is 35 people. So the first 35 people that will book their place here, at the Meetup will attend it. The rest will have the opportunity to attend it on Wednesday 4/9/2019.

Bring with you:
-Positive attitude,
-Hunger for learning &
-The password of your Gmail account

Don't bring:
-Your laptop, there are PC's waiting for you,
-Credit Card, the Qwiklabs are FREE, you get $55 for 1 month &
-Beers to the Facilitator, he is allergic to beers! ü§£

AGENDA:

17:30 doors open
17:45 Intro - Icebreakers - LogIn
18:00 "A Tour of Qwiklabs and the Google Cloud Platform"
18:45 "Creating a Virtual Machine"
19:20 Break for 10 minute
19:30 "Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud"
20:15 Next Steps - Thank you!
20:30 Bye Bye

The event is Co-organized by YET.
events.how_to_find_us: The Cloud Study Jam will be at Ethra Lab, on the 5th floor.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - Facilitator Candidates

venue.name: CITY College, International Faculty of the University of Sheffield

events.description:
Cloud Study Jam is study groups organized by GDG's. In these study groups, the attendees get personal tutoring by the Facilitators and study with peers.

Facilitators are the backbone of the Study Jams. If you want to become a Facilitator you must have attended, at least one, a Study Jam, believe in voluntarism, be willing to learn new things, love to talk to others, have a passion for what you will do!

AGENDA:

18:00 doors open
18:05 Intro - Icebreakers
18:15 Talk - From the other side
19:30 Break
19:45 Talk - Changing roles
20:30 Next Steps - Thank you!
21:00 Beeralizing

The Cloud Study Jam is hosted by CITY College, International Faculty of the University of Sheffield, on the 5th floor, at Ethra Lab.

The event is Co-organized by YET.

events.name: KOTLIN/Everywhere

venue.name: ibis Styles Heraklion Central

events.description:
This is a community-led event, where you can learn the essentials and best practices of Kotlin in Android, Google Cloud, and multi-platforms, for more information about the speakers and slots, please refer to https://gdggreece.gr

Kotlin is a modern and statically typed programming language targeting the JVM, Android, JavaScript & Native that will boost your productivity and increase your developer happiness.

Kotlin/Everywhere is part of the Singularity Festival, a city-wide festival of events, that takes place in Heraklion, Crete on the 23-29 of September. During the week we will see a variety of top tech events focused on different technologies.

REGISTRATION IS MANDATORY
Single & Combo tickets are available here:
https://singularityfestival.io/attend/

events.name: FlutterExp

venue.name: ibis Styles Heraklion Central

events.description:
FlutterExp* is the first European community driven event dedicated to Flutter‚Ñ¢ Explore hand first what‚Äôs new in the Flutter‚Ñ¢ world, enjoy Talks and Meet with experts coming from every corner of the world, it doesn‚Äôt matter if you are a Developer or a Designer everyone is invited to share their experience, bringing high quality content and experiences to the communities.

All related info about this year's FlutterExp can be found on the official site: https://flutterexp.com/

FlutterExp is part of the Singularity Festival, a city-wide festival of events, that takes place in Heraklion, Crete on the 23-29 of September. During the week we will see a variety of top tech events focused on different technologies.

REGISTRATION IS MANDATORY
Single & Combo tickets are available here:
https://singularityfestival.io/attend/

events.name: Diversity Summit 2019

venue.name: ibis Styles Heraklion Central

events.description:
Diversity Summit 2019 is dedicated to improving fairness and equity by recognizing the inherent value of every person and group.
At the Diversity Summit, human resource professionals, managers, developers, academia, Public Administration, diversity specialists and employees will learn about various initiative that promote equality and inclusion and will have a unique opportunity to networking.
Join us to foster an environment of respect and understanding and show how we can build a stronger, more inclusive and competitive organization that reflects the diversity of our workforce and customer base.

All related info about this year's Diversity Summit 2019 can be found on our official site: http://diversitysummit.yet.org.gr/

Diversity Summit 2019 is part of the Singularity Festival, a city-wide festival of events, that takes place in Heraklion, Crete on the 23-29 of September. During the week we will see a variety of top tech events focused on different technologies.

REGISTRATION IS MANDATORY
Single & Combo tickets are available here:
https://singularityfestival.io/attend/

events.name: DevFest Greece 2019

venue.name: ibis Styles Heraklion Central

events.description:
DevFest hits its 5th time in Heraklion and 7th time in Greece! Organized by the GDGs in Greece it covers multiple products such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Deep Learning with TensorFlow, and mobile web.

Events may include speaker sessions, hackathons, codelabs, study jams, and trainings. It is an open to the public event thatgives to the audience a wider covergae of Google technologies. This year we will host as well talks and codelabs on tools for growing your business and startup
All related info about this year's DevFest Greece can be found on our official site: https://gdggreece.gr/

Devfest Greece is part of the Singularity Festival, a city-wide festival of events, that takes place in Heraklion, Crete on the 23-29 of September. During the week we will see a variety of top tech events focused on different technologies.

REGISTRATION IS MANDATORY
Single & Combo tickets are available here:
https://singularityfestival.io/attend/

events.name: Firebase Team @DevFest Greece | Special Track

venue.name: ibis Styles Heraklion Central

events.description:
Firebase is Google's mobile platform that helps you quickly develop high-quality apps and grow your business.
During our Devfest this year we will have a special track on Firebase hosted by the Google Firebase Team:
Kiana McNellis
Alex Memering
Etienne Kenny
Please stay tuned for the exact time slots.

REGISTRATION IS MANDATORY
Single & Combo tickets are available here:
https://singularityfestival.io/attend/

events.name: CLOUD Next | A Day with Jordan | Live Streaming

venue.name: CITY College, International Faculty of the University of Sheffield

events.description:
For us who cannot be in Athens, there is the Live Streaming Solution at the Auditorium on the 5th floor of City College.

Jordan Tigani is the PM director for BigQuery, and was one of the people who created BigQuery several years ago, his main area of expertise is Data Analytics!

AGENDA:
18:00 Door Opening
18:30 - 19:30 "Modernizing your data analytics with BigQuery"
19:30 - 20:00 Q&A
20:00 Beeralizing

The event is co-organized with Digital Analytics & YET.

events.name: Speedrun Challenge #1: BigQuery Basics for Data Analysts
events.description:
It's a WEBINAR (online) - no physical presence is required.

How does it work?

Register online at http://bit.ly/gdgath_csc
Receive access and more info, before the Speedrun starts.

Monday, 3rd of February 2020 at 20:00
Join the 2-hour online FREE webinar, and learn from a Google trainer all about the topic - finish the first lab together!

Instructor: Michael Abel - Data & ML Technical Trainer at Google
Topic: BigQuery Basics for Data Analysts
Lab: Introduction to SQL for BigQuery and Cloud SQL
Introduction to SQL for BigQuery and Cloud SQL, BigQuery: Qwik Start - Console, Predict Visitor Purchases with a Classification Model in BQML, Working with JSON, Arrays, and Structs in BigQuery.

Within the same week | 3/2 - 9/2:
Complete all of the labs as fast as you can at https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/69 (you can play each of the labs up to 5 times to score your best time). Check out the leaderboards and see how much you scored (will be updated soon).

üéÅ Prizes (Good luck everyone!)
‚óæ All participants will get a one-month free subscription to Qwiklabs and earn a badge for each Speedrun they complete.
‚óæ Top 5 of each Speedrun will receive $25 voucher for the Google Merchandise Store.
‚óæ Top Winner from each Speedrun receives an extra $50 voucher for the Google Merchandise Store.

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in February where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to join 4 Speedruns and get hands-on experience with tools like Kubernetes, Assistant, BigQuery and Cloud Run. Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

events.name: Speedrun Challenge #2: Kubernetes on Google Cloud
events.description:
It's a WEBINAR (online) - no physical presence is required.

How does it work?

Register online at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeT_RRdqmUO2y32JAX0aV3ESbeKPWaa5xf0sjxsJKm6ho8Qwg/viewform

Receive access and more info, before the Speedrun starts.

Monday, 10th of February 2020 at 19:00 (GMT)
Join the 2-hour online FREE webinar, and learn from a Google trainer all about the topic - finish the first lab together!

Instructor: Sam Marder - Software Engineer at Google Cloud
Topic: Kubernetes in the Google Cloud
Lab: Kubernetes Engine: Qwik Start, Introduction to Docker, Orchestrating the Cloud with Kubernetes, Managing Deployments Using Kubernetes Engine

Within the same week | 10/2 - 16/2:
Complete all of the labs as fast as you can at https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/29 (you can play each of the labs up to 5 times to score your best time). Check out the leaderboards and see how much you scored (will be updated soon).

üéÅ Prizes (Good luck everyone!)
‚óæ All participants will get a one-month free subscription to Qwiklabs and earn a badge for each Speedrun they complete.
‚óæ Top 5 of each Speedrun will receive $25 voucher for the Google Merchandise Store.
‚óæ Top Winner from each Speedrun receives an extra $50 voucher for the Google Merchandise Store.

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in February where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to join 4 Speedruns and get hands-on experience with tools like Kubernetes, Assistant, BigQuery and Cloud Run. Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

events.name: Speedrun Challenge #4: Cloud Run
events.description:
It's a WEBINAR (online) - no physical presence is required.

How does it work?

Register online at https://events.withgoogle.com/communityspeedrunchallenge/

Receive access and more info, before the Speedrun starts.

Monday, 24th of February 2020 at 19:00 (GMT),
Greek Time Zone = 20:00
Join the 2-hour online FREE webinar, and learn from a Google trainer all about the topic - finish the first lab together!

Instructor: Marek Biskup - Senior Software Engineer at Google Cloud
Topic: Introduction to Cloud Run
Lab: Hello Cloud Run, Build a Serverless App with Cloud Run that Creates PDF Files, Share Data Securely via a REST API Using Cloud Run and Build a Resilient, Build a Resilient, Asynchronous System with Cloud Run and Cloud PubSub

Within the same week | 24/2 - 1/3:
Complete all of the labs as fast as you can at https://bit.ly/2VbEWeh (you can play each of the labs up to 5 times to score your best time). Check out the leaderboards and see how much you scored (will be updated soon).

üéÅ Prizes (Good luck everyone!)
‚óæ All participants will get a one-month free subscription to Qwiklabs and earn a badge for each Speedrun they complete.
‚óæ Top 5 of each Speedrun will receive $25 voucher for the Google Merchandise Store.
‚óæ Top Winner from each Speedrun receives an extra $50 voucher for the Google Merchandise Store.

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in February where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to join 4 Speedruns and get hands-on experience with tools like Kubernetes, Assistant, BigQuery and Cloud Run. Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

events.name: Firebase Study Jam

venue.name: CITY College, International Faculty of the University of Sheffield

events.description:
Firebase‚Äôs mission is to: Help app developers succeed!

So what is Firebase?

Firebase is Google‚Äôs client-side application development platform, with a mission to help app developers of all sizes (large or small) succeed with their products.

Firebase accomplishes this by taking common problems that occur during a product‚Äôs lifecycle and making them easier to solve, be it by providing more information about your products, or providing tools to handle complex problems like security or network connectivity when storing data.

Firebase is divided into three main categories of tools with specific goals:
- helping you build better apps by making complex coding processes easier
- improving app quality by helping you catch issues early and fixing them quickly
- and helping you grow your app by understanding how other people are using it, and engaging with them in a meaningful way

There are almost 20 different products within Firebase. While that may seem like a lot, and we‚Äôre going to briefly discuss each of them, the average developer will only use a handful of them in each app. The goal isn‚Äôt to overwhelm you, but rather to let you know what‚Äôs available when you need it.

Agenda:
17:45 Doors Opening
18:00 - 18:15 Breaking Ice - Introduction
18:15 - 20:30 Firebase Study Jam
20:30 - 20:50 Q&A
20:50-21:00 Get ready for Beeralizing!

_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_*_

events.name: Community Speedrun Challenge #1

venue.name: Online event

events.description:
Hello!

We‚Äôre sure most of you are interested in learning new technologies and tools. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to participate in the first Community Speedrun Challenge that Google is organizing for developer communities in Europe. And as part of the GDG Cloud Thessaloniki, you‚Äôre among the first to know about this!!

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in May where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to join four Speedruns and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning on Google Cloud, and take your first steps with tools like BigQuery, Cloud Speech API, and Cloud ML Engine. Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

Find more information and register here: bit.ly/speedrunchallengeeurope

Schedule:
Speedrun Date: May 4
Webinar Time: Monday from 19:00 to 21:00 pm (GMT+2) or
20:00-22:00 Greek Time Zone
Topics
Baseline: Data, ML, AI

Lab: Classify Images of Clouds in the Cloud with AutoML Vision

Trainer: Zack Akil (Machine Learning Developer Advocate at Google)

üéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâüéâ

########### HOW TO WIN ##########
############### F R E E ############
##### JetBrains product license #####

1. Register to the Community Speedrun Challenge,
2. Finish all the labs and take a screenshot that will show your Account and the Completed Quest,
3. Upload your screenshot on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and use both of the 2 following Hashtags: #GDGCloudThessaloniki #GDGCloudGreece,
4. Send me, here, a DM with a screenshot from your post at the social media,
5. If you post to 1 of the above social media you'll get one chance to draw your name. If you post on 2 different social media you'll have 2 chances and for 3 posts, one for each of the above social media you'll have 3 chances.
6. You must send me a DM until Friday, May 8.
7. The draw will take place on Saturday, May 9 and the winner will be informed with a DM here and will be announced on our Social Media pages.

FB: https://www.facebook.com/gdgcloudgreece
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/gdg-cloud-greece/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/gdgcloudgreece
